newsitem.title: CANADA: Quebec plans 5 percent payroll cost cut in 1997/98.
newsitem.headline: Quebec plans 5 percent payroll cost cut in 1997/98.

text.p: Quebec said on Tuesday that it planned to cut its payroll costs by 5 percent or C$1.4 billion in the 1997/98 fiscal year.
The cuts are part of Quebec's efforts to ensure that it meets its budget deficit projections for the coming fiscal years.
"We cannot meet our (budget) objectives without cutting workforce costs," Quebec Treasury Board President Jacques Leonard told reporters.

The government wants to cut payroll costs for its civil servants and other unionized employees by five percent. Elected officials and their staff also faced a five percent pay cut, but the reduction would not affect their expense accounts and benefits, Leonard said.
Leonard said 58 percent of the government's costs were related to wages.
Leonard said Quebec was also looking into the possibility of reducing civil servants' work weeks to 32 hours from 35.

Quebec has said it planned to reduce its annual budget deficit to C$3.275 billion in 1996/97, C$2.2 billion in 1997/98, C$1.2 billion in 1998/99 and zero in 1999/2000 from a forecast C$3.9 billion in 1995/96.
